youtube_strategy.seo_critical: Title, description, tags all optimized for search
youtube_strategy.first_30_seconds: Must hook viewer or they bounce
youtube_strategy.end_screens: Always link to next video + subscribe prompt

main_channel_scripts.title: I Rated 50 Tracks in One Day - Here's What I Learned About the Music Industry
main_channel_scripts.thumbnail_concept: Split screen - serious face + rating interface showing 50 tracks

script.00:00_00:30_hook:
I just spent 6 hours rating 50 tracks on Frequency Factory. Half were incredible. Half were... not. And what I learned about why some tracks work and others don't is going to change how you think about making music.

Stick around because I'm breaking down the patterns, showing you the certified tracks, and explaining exactly what separates a hit from a miss.

Let's get into it.
script.00:30_01:30_setup:
Quick context: Frequency Factory is a platform where anyone can become an A&R operative. You listen to submitted tracks, rate them on Hook Strength and Production Quality, earn tokens, climb ranks.

I'm an Executive rank now, which means I've rated hundreds of tracks. But today I wanted to do something different - marathon 50 tracks in one session and see what patterns emerge.

So I clocked in, grabbed my headphones, and started rating. Here's what happened.
script.01:30_09:00_main_content:
[SECTION 1: THE CERTIFIED TRACKS (3 mins)]
"Out of 50 tracks, only 3 hit Factory Certified status - that's a 90+ average rating. Let me show you why these worked."

[Play snippet of Track 1]
"Track 1: This hook hits at 0:06. Six seconds. That's the magic window. If you don't grab people by then, they're scrolling. Listen to this..."
[Break down the hook, explain why it works]
"Hook: 9.3/10. Production: 9.0/10. This is getting certified."

[Repeat for Tracks 2 and 3]

[SECTION 2: THE COMMON MISTAKES (3 mins)]
"Now let's talk about why 35 of these 50 tracks got below an 8. Here are the 5 patterns I saw over and over:

1. THE LATE HOOK PROBLEM
[Show examples]
"12 tracks didn't get to the hook until after 30 seconds. That's way too late. In 2025, you have 10 seconds max. Fix this and your ratings jump immediately."

2. MUDDY VOCAL MIXING
[Show examples]
"I couldn't understand the lyrics in 8 different tracks. Not because of accent or style - because the vocals were buried in the mix. EQ your vocals. Make them clear. Non-negotiable."

[Continue with other patterns: blown out mastering, generic beats, off-key vocals]

[SECTION 3: THE SURPRISING DISCOVERIES (2 mins)]
"But here's what shocked me: 5 tracks that I initially wanted to skip turned out to be really good after I gave them 30 more seconds."
[Examples]
"This teaches us something: Sometimes great music doesn't follow the formula. Sometimes it builds. Sometimes it rewards patience.

But - and this is critical - if you're going to break the rules, everything else needs to be perfect. Your production, your mix, your performance. You don't get to be experimental AND sloppy."

[Show specific examples of rule-breaking tracks that worked]
script.09:00_11:00_artist_shoutouts:
Alright, here are the artists whose tracks got certified today:

[Show each artist, their track, their rating, why it worked]
"@ArtistName - 'Track Title' - 9.3/10 - Go follow them right now. Link in description."

[Repeat for all certified artists]

"These artists understood the assignment. Study their tracks. Learn from what works."

[Also give honorable mentions to near-certified tracks]
script.11:00_12:00_outro:
So what did I learn from rating 50 tracks in one day?

1. Great hooks are rare. When you have one, you know immediately.
2. Production mistakes are fixable. Hook problems are fundamental.
3. Most artists are closer to success than they think - they just need better feedback.
4. The community ratings at Frequency Factory are shockingly accurate. Collective wisdom is real.

If you're an artist, submit your track. Link in description. Let the factory rate it. Get real feedback from real listeners.

If you're a music fan, become an operative. Link in description. Start rating. Earn tokens. Help discover the next wave of talent.

I'll be doing another 50-track marathon next week. Subscribe so you don't miss it.

Leave a comment: What's the ONE thing that makes you skip a track instantly?

See you in the next one."

[END SCREEN: Subscribe + Next Video + Frequency Factory Link]

main_channel_scripts.title: How to Rate Music Like a Professional A&R (Frequency Factory Tutorial)
main_channel_scripts.thumbnail_concept: Person with headphones + rating interface + "A&R Training" text

script.00:00_00:30_hook:
You're rating music wrong. And I can prove it.

Today I'm going to teach you how to rate tracks like a professional A&R executive. By the end of this video, you'll understand why certain tracks work, how to articulate what makes music good, and how to improve your rating accuracy on Frequency Factory from 60% to 90%+.

This is A&R training. Let's begin.
script.00:30_02:00_framework:
First, understand what you're actually rating:

Frequency Factory has two metrics:
1. Hook Strength (1-10)
2. Production Quality (1-10)

These aren't random. These are the two things that predict commercial success.

Hook = Can people remember and sing this?
Production = Does it sound professional?

Everything else - lyrics, genre, style, message - that's subjective. But hooks and production? Those are measurable.

Let me show you how to evaluate each one.
script.09:30_10:00_outro:
That's the framework. Two simple metrics. Clear evaluation criteria.

Your homework:
1. Go to Frequency Factory (link below)
2. Rate 10 tracks using this framework
3. Compare your ratings to the community average
4. Adjust your calibration
5. Repeat until you hit 90%+ accuracy

Once you master this, you'll never listen to music the same way again. You'll hear hooks, production, potential. You'll think like A&R.

And that's a superpower in the music industry.

Link to Frequency Factory in description. Start training.

Subscribe for more A&R education.

See you in the next one."

[END SCREEN]

main_channel_scripts.title: Factory Certified Tracks This Week - New Music You Need to Hear
main_channel_scripts.thumbnail_concept: "FACTORY CERTIFIED" badge + collage of artist photos

script.00:00_00:20_hook:
These are the tracks that got Factory Certified this week. All rated 90+ by the community. All deserving your attention right now.

No playlist politics. No label money. Just pure talent validated by real listeners.

Let's discover some music.
script.00:20_07:00_track_features:
[For each certified track - approximately 1 minute each]

TRACK 1:
"First up: [Artist Name] - '[Track Title]'

[Play 20-30 second snippet - best part]

Community Rating: 9.3/10
Hook: 9.5/10 | Production: 9.1/10

Why this works:
[30 seconds of analysis - what makes the hook great, production highlights, why it certified]

'This is the kind of track that labels are looking for. Clean execution, memorable hook, commercial appeal. Go follow @[artist] right now.'

[Show artist's other platforms, streaming links]

---

[Repeat format for 5-7 certified tracks]
script.07:00_08:00_outro:
That's this week's Factory Certified lineup. Seven tracks. Seven artists who deserve your support.

Links to every artist in the description. Go stream them. Follow them. Share them with friends.

This is how we change the music industry - by celebrating real talent, not algorithm gaming.

If you're an artist and you want your track reviewed, link in description to submit to Frequency Factory. 

If you're a music fan, link in description to become an operative and help discover next week's certified tracks.

New roundup every Friday. Subscribe so you don't miss it.

Leave a comment: Which track was your favorite?

See you next week."

[END SCREEN]
